div.a: Will We Ever Have Safe Cigarettes?

div.div: For decades the tobacco industry has tried to come up with alternatives that people would want to smoke, but this is much harder than you would think.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TIJv4x&via=Digg&text=Will We Ever Have Safe Cigarettes?

div.a: Pig Genome Project May Pave The Way For Better Bacon

div.div: Could bacon get any tastier? Pig scientists and breeders say indeed it could, now that the pig genome has been sequenced and a trove of new genetic information is available.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/T0LfaP&via=Digg&text=Pig Genome Project May Pave The Way For Better Bacon

div.a: The Downside Of Warp Drives: Annihilating Whole Star Systems When You Arrive

div.div: NASA researchers recently revisited the Alcubierre warp drive and concluded that its power requirements were not as impossible as once thought. However, a new analysis from the University of Sydney claims that using a warp drive of this design comes with a drawback. Specifically, it could cause cataclysmic explosions at your destination.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U435wK&via=Digg&text=The Downside Of Warp Drives: Annihilating Whole Star Systems When You Arrive

div.a: The End-All, Be-All Guide To Using Your Phone At The Table

div.div: The ubiquity of smartphones in restaurants now has even led to calls for a hard ban. But the use of phones at the table should be a matter of etiquette, not law, so here is the definitive road map to using your phone at the table.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZAGkCD&via=Digg&text=The End-All, Be-All Guide To Using Your Phone At The Table

div.a: Someone Please Make This iPhone Smart Cover

div.div: If you are going to sheath your gorgeous Apple device, this would be the best way to do it.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QJloYH&via=Digg&text=Someone Please Make This iPhone Smart Cover

div.a: The Uncommon Features Of Einstein's Brain That Might Explain His Brilliance

div.div: Portions of Albert Einstein's brain have been found to be unlike those of most people and could be related to his extraordinary cognitive abilities, according to a new study led by Florida State University evolutionary anthropologist Dean Falk.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WdyRcY&via=Digg&text=The Uncommon Features Of Einstein's Brain That Might Explain His Brilliance

div.a: What The New Twitter Will Look Like

div.div: If you want to know what your Twitter timeline is going to look like, there's a preview already hidden in your Twitter app.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U4nvFR&via=Digg&text=What The New Twitter Will Look Like

div.div: DID IT HAVE TO REMOVE ITS TIMING BELT?

div.a: Ford Built An Engine So Small They Were Able To Send It Through Airport Security

div.div: Going through TSA checkpoints when flying is always a chore. You have to chug your booze, take off your shoes, belt, aluminum underpants, empty your pockets, and take your laptop and engine blocks out of your carry-on bags.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZYnchc&via=Digg&text=Ford Built An Engine So Small They Were Able To Send It Through Airport Security

div.a: Meet The Woman Censored By Facebook While Outing Sexism

div.div: The picture in question is that of a woman in her underwear, gagged, bound, and suspended from a metal pole carried by a gang of men. Beneath it the caption: “Feminist found in town this morning—captured and put on the grill.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PYtDis&via=Digg&text=Meet The Woman Censored By Facebook While Outing Sexism

div.div: WE'RE ALL KNIGHTS OF SUMMER NOW
If you were born in or after April 1985, if you are right now 27 years old or younger, you have never lived through a month that was colder than average. That’s beyond astonishing.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TI9AR5&via=Digg&text=Cold Comfort

div.div: 'WE THE PEOPLE' WANT SOME SILLY STUFF

div.a: The 10 Craziest Citizen Petitions To The White House

div.div: Petition number 29 to the government website "We The People" calls for deporting anyone who signed a petition for their state to secede. Call it the anti-petition petition.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Wb8wHO&via=Digg&text=The 10 Craziest Citizen Petitions To The White House

div.a: Can A Paint Job Change A Neighborhood's Future?

div.div: But, as a tough Philadelphia neighborhood is vividly demonstrating, creative street painting can really make a big difference to its community.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XhdGYS&via=Digg&text=Can A Paint Job Change A Neighborhood's Future?

div.div: IN CASE YOU DIDN'T GET ENOUGH 'INCEPTION'

div.a: Falling In A Bath Tub In Super Slow Motion

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PWhScm&via=Digg&text=Falling In A Bath Tub In Super Slow Motion

div.div: "STOP," a documentary on the NYPD’s controversial and racially-charged stop-and-frisk policy, was recently funded on Kickstarter, and will be released next year.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TIihLr&via=Digg&text=Stop-And-Frisk, The Documentary

div.a: Marijuana Dispenser Machine Company's Stock Gets Really High, Man

div.div: Medbox, a firm that makes medical marijuana dispensing machines, says its stock "is getting way too high."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QiLIJr&via=Digg&text=Marijuana Dispenser Machine Company's Stock Gets Really High, Man

div.a: They Cracked This 250 Year-Old Code, And Found a Secret Society Inside

div.div: The decoding effort started as a sort of game between two friends that eventually engulfed a team of experts in disciplines ranging from machine translation to intellectual history. Its significance goes far beyond the contents of a single cipher. Hidden within coded manuscripts like these is a secret history of how esoteric, often radical notions of science, politics, and religion spread underground.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SP8aJ4&via=Digg&text=They Cracked This 250 Year-Old Code, And Found a Secret Society Inside

div.a: Taliban Fails To BCC An Email, Reveals Its Entire PR Mailing List

div.div: A slip of the hand by a Taliban spokesperson has revealed the members of the group’s mailing list. The 400 e-mail addresses include many journalists, but also a few members of government as well as “academics and activists.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XhDR1J&via=Digg&text=Taliban Fails To BCC An Email, Reveals Its Entire PR Mailing List

div.div: TRY TELLING TIME ON THIS CLOCK
The 365 Knitting Clock stitches time as it passes by. It knits 24 hours a day and one year at the time. After 365 days the clock has turned the passed year into a 2 m long scarf.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QiFWHC&via=Digg&text=The Clock That Knits

div.div: In the debate about the fiscal cliff, it is clear that private philanthropy will have a continuing and growing role. Here are a few things that may surprise you about the art of doing good.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QiDroG&via=Digg&text=Five Surprising Things About Philanthropy

div.a: Suing 'Girls Gone Wild' Over A Bare-Breasted Video

div.div: Should a girl who bared her breasts at 14 win her lawsuit against the video company?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZTwxXo&via=Digg&text=Suing 'Girls Gone Wild' Over A Bare-Breasted Video

div.a: When A Name Brand Just Won’t Do: Hollywood’s Best Fake Products

div.div: Spark up a Bilson and read this story about when content producers eschew realism (and revenue) and go for fake-product placement.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QiK0rl&via=Digg&text=When A Name Brand Just Won’t Do: Hollywood’s Best Fake Products

div.a: The Coming Threat To Your Craft Brew

div.div: Craft is a real threat to big corporations because it represents a growing thirst for real beer; but it's also an opportunity, because that thirst can be co-opted by knockoffs.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QMqljF&via=Digg&text=The Coming Threat To Your Craft Brew

div.a: The Tech Team That Helped Obama Win The Election

div.div: President Obama's reelection campaign brought 40 engineers into their ranks to build the technology they needed to get the president reelected. This is the very human story of how they helped out, even if they never fit in.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/T6aZ8I&via=Digg&text=The Tech Team That Helped Obama Win The Election

div.a: Superbugs Are Spreading In Europe As Antibiotics Are Overused

div.div: Superbugs are spreading at an alarming rate in Europe as antibiotics used to fight even common infections are growing increasingly ineffective though widespread overuse and misuse.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RYmRZy&via=Digg&text=Superbugs Are Spreading In Europe As Antibiotics Are Overused
